intro: Trichanthodium, commonly known as the "star-of-Bethlehem," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plants are perennial herbs with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. They are native to regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. Trichanthodium species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
